title: Debt relief improves psychological and cognitive function, enabling better decision-making

title_detail.value: Debt relief improves psychological and cognitive function, enabling better decision-making

summary: A new study demonstrates that reducing the number of debt accounts lowers the mental burden of the poor, thereby improving psychological and cognitive performance. This enables better decision-making. Hence, poverty interventions should be structured to improve psychological and cognitive functioning in addition to addressing the financial needs of the poor.
